meanings.sent1: The old shoes were unfit for the long hike.
meanings.sent2: Wearing a swimsuit to a job interview would be unfit.
meanings.sent3: It would be unfit to wear pajamas to a wedding.
meanings.sent4: His torn umbrella was unfit for the heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The rusty key was unfit to open the new lock.

meanings.definition: Not in good physical or mental condition
meanings.sent1: The sick dog looked very unfit to play fetch.
meanings.sent2: After the long race, she felt tired and unfit.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat seemed unfit to catch any mice.
meanings.sent4: The cracked mirror reflected an unfit image.
meanings.sent5: The dim light made the room look unfit for reading.

meanings.sent1: He was unfit to lead the team due to lack of experience.
meanings.sent2: The student felt unfit to solve the complex math problem.
meanings.sent3: The chef felt unfit to cook a gourmet meal without proper training.
meanings.sent4: The broken compass was unfit to guide them through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The old computer was unfit to handle the new software.
